post.summary: Destroy artifact files of the job with the given id

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job to destroy artifacts for

204.description: Expected response to a valid request

get.summary: Get the artifacts files for the job with the given id

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Id of the job to get artifacts for

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Optional; if getting only certain files, a wildcard pattern to match against, e.g., "myfiles*".  Note: if you include a wildcard you must double-quote the files argument.

parameters.name: dest
parameters.description: Optional; an existing directory to copy the artifacts files to.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Optional; return JSON object instead of writing to standard out.  '--json' with no value is equivalent to true.

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

get.summary: List job artifact files for the specified job

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Id of the job to list artifacts for

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Optional; wildcard expression of file(s) to list, e.g., "myfiles*".  Note: if you include a wildcard you must double-quote the files argument.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Optional; include file size in bytes.  '--size' with no value is equivalent to true.

parameters.name: links
parameters.description: Optional; include https links to artifacts.  Note: links are only valid for 8 hours. '--links' with no value is equivalent to true.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Optional; return JSON object instead of writing to standard out.  '--json' with no value is equivalent to true.

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

parameters.description: Id of the job to clone

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

get.summary: List information about all jobs available to either the current authenticated user or the team, if the user belongs to a team

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Optional project to match on.  If neither project nor projectId are provided, this is taken from the .ps_project/config.json file, or the current directory name.  Specify 'all' to list jobs for all projects associated with the user or team if the user is on a team.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Optional projectId to match on

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Optional job name to match on

parameters.name: machineType
parameters.description: Optional machineType to match on

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Optional state value to match on

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: Optional container to match on

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: Optional command to match on

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: Optional workspace path to match on.  Note: the original workspace path will be modified on upload to point to a temporary location.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Optional dataset to match on

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

get.summary: Stream the logs for the job with the given id, while the job is running or after it has stopped

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Id of the job to logs

parameters.name: tail
parameters.description: Optional; if tail is specified logs will be streamed until the job stops.

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: Optional; if line is specified logs only logs after that line will be returned (up to limit).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional; number of log lines to retrieve on each request; default limit is 2000.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Optional; return JSON object instead of writing to standard out.  '--json' with no value is equivalent to true.

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

files.description: Optional; if destroying only certain files, a wildcard pattern to match against, e.g., "myfiles*".  Note: if you include a wildcard you must double-quote the files argument.

container.description: A required reference to a docker image in a public or private docker registry, or a container name provided by Paperspace.  Docker image repository references must be in lowercase and may include a tag and a hostname prefix followed by a slash; if ommitted the hostname defaults to that of the public Docker Hub registry.  An example docker image reference: 'docker.io/mynamespace/myimage:mytag'.  A container name may be mixed case.  (Designated container names are currently only provided as part of various Gradient tutorials and samples.)

cluster.description: An optional cluster name of a cluster to run the job on. Only one of cluster or clusterId may be specified.

clusterId.description: An optional cluster id of a cluster to run the job on. Only one of cluster or clusterId may be specified.

machineType.description:
An optional machine type to run the job on: either 'GPU+', 'P4000', 'P5000', 'P6000', 'V100', 'K80', 'P100', 'TPU', or 'GradientNode'.

Defaults to 'K80'.

Note: the 'K80', 'P100', and 'TPU' machineTypes run on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). The other machineTypes run on the Paperspace Cloud. Google Cloud platform and Paperspace Cloud have distict Job Storage spaces; Job storage is not currently shared between these two cloud environments.

name.description: An optional name or description for this job.  If ommitted, the job name defaults to 'job N' where N represents the Nth job instance for the given project.

project.description: The name of the project for this job.  If not provided, this is taken from the .ps_project/config.json file, or the current directory name.

projectId.description: The poject id of an existing project for this job.  Note: if projectId is specified, the project parameter cannot be specified.

command.description: An optional command to run within the workspace or container.

workspace.description: An optional path to a workspace, or link to a git repository to upload and merge with the container.  If a zip file name is provided it is uploaded instead.  If no workspace is provided the current directory is zipped up and transferred.  If the workspace is 'none', no workspace is merged and the container is run as-is. To download a git repository provide an https repository link and optionally prefix it with 'git+', e.g. 'https://github.com/MyProjects/MyRepo.git'.  If the 'git+' prefix is not specified, it is added at the time of download to the job runner machine.  S3 links are also supported using the schema 's3://bucketname/objectname'.

codeCommit.description: An optional reference to git commit hash if local workspace is a git repository. Found at runtime.

dataset.description: An optional reference to a dataset to be merged with the container.

registryUsername.description: An optional username for accessing an image hosted on a private container registry.  Note: you must specify this option every time a private image is specified for the container.

registryPassword.description: An optional password for accessing an image hosted on a private container registry.  Note: you must specify this option every time a private image is specified for the container.

workspaceUsername.description: An optional username for accessing a private git repository.  Note: you must specify this option every time a private git repository is specified for the workspace.

workspacePassword.description: An optional password for accessing a private git repository. We recommned using an OAuth token (GitHub instructions can be found here). Note: you must specify this option every time a private git repository is specified for the workspace.

ports.description: An optional list of port mappings to open on the job cluster machine while the job is running.  The port mappings are specified as 'XXXX:YYYY' where XXXX is an external port number and YYYY is an internal port number.  Mulitple port mappings can be provided as a comma separated list. Port numbers must be greater than 1023. Note: only /tcp protocol usage is supported.

sharedMemMBytes.description: Optional; shared memory size for the job container in megabytes (1 megabyte = 1024 * 1024 bytes).  Cannot exceed total memory size for the given machine type.

nodeAttrs.description: Optional; a JSON expression describing the node attributes for a compatible GradientNode machine to run this job.  See the Gradient-Node documentation for more info.

tail.description: Optional; defaults to true in command line mode only.  Specify false to disable automatic tailing.

json.description: Optional; if true, do not write progress to standard out.  '--json' with no value is equivalent to true.

email.description: Email address of the paperspace user to log in

password.description: Password for the specified email address

apiToken.description: Optional name of an existing API token for the user's account

region.description: Name of the region: either 'East Coast (NY2)', 'West Coast (CA1)', or 'Europe (AMS1)'

machineType.description:
Machine type: either 'Air', 'Standard', 'Pro', 'Advanced', 'GPU+', 'P4000', 'P5000', 'P6000', 'V100', 'C1', 'C2', 'C3', 'C4', 'C5', 'C6', 'C7', 'C8', 'C9', or 'C10'

Note:
Windows os templates cannot be used to create CPU-only machine types 'C1' - 'C10'.
Ubuntu os templates cannot be used to create GRID GPU machine types: 'Air', 'Standard', 'Pro', or 'Advanced'.

size.description: Storage size for the machine in GB

machineName.description: A memorable name for this machine

templateId.description: Template id of the template to use for creating this machine

assignPublicIp.description: Assign a new public ip address on machine creation. Cannot be used with dynamicPublicIp.

dynamicPublicIp.description: Assigns a new public ip address on machine start and releases it from the account on machine stop. Cannot be used with assignPublicIp.

networkId.description: If creating on a specific network, specify its id

teamId.description: If creating the machine for a team, specify the team id

userId.description: If assigning to an existing user other than yourself, specify the user id (mutually exclusive with email, password, firstName, lastName)

email.description: If creating a new user for this machine, specify their email address (mutually exclusive with userId)

password.description: If creating a new user, specify their password (mutually exclusive with userId)

firstName.description: If creating a new user, specify their first name (mutually exclusive with userId)

lastName.description: If creating a new user, specify their last name (mutually exclusive with userId)

notificationEmail.description: Send a notification to this email address when complete

scriptId.description: The script id of a script to be run on startup.  See the [Script Guide]{@link https://paperspace.github.io/paperspace-node/scripts.md} for more info on using scripts.

releasePublicIp.description: releases any assigned public ip address for the machine; defaults to false

shutdownTimeoutInHours.description: Number of hours before machine is shutdown if no one is logged in via the Paperspace client

shutdownTimeoutForces.description: Force shutdown at shutdown timeout, even if there is a Paperspace client connection

dynamicPublicIp.description: If true, assigns a new public ip address on machine start and releases it from the account on machine stop

scriptName.description: A unique name for the script

scriptFile.description: File path to a file containing the script data; either scriptFile or scriptText must be provide.

scriptText.description: A string containing the script text; either scriptFile or scriptText must be provide.

isEnabled.description: Determines if the script is enabled or not.  Defaults to true

runOnce.description: Determines if the script is run on first boot or every boot.  Defaults to false

machineId.description: Machine id of a machine that should execute this script at startup
